prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of Robert Underwood Johnson, Accession #7806, Clifton Waller Barrett Library of American Literature, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was deposited by Clifton Waller Barrett on December 17, 1963, accessioned on January 20, 1965, and changed to a gift on July 1, 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 12 items, chiefly correspondence of Robert Underwood Johnson.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of two series. Series I contains manuscripts, and Series II contains correspondence.

did.unittitle: Robert Underwood Johnson to W. Rice 1885 March 28;

scopecontent.p: Sends article by George Rutledge Gibson which he will not use in Century but thinks Rice might want for The North American Review.

did.unittitle: Robert Underwood Johnson to Samuel L. Clemens 1891 June 8;

scopecontent.p: Suggests that Twain write a book about his trip abroad ["Mark Twain Abroad") and allow the Century to publish it in serial form.

did.unittitle: Lathrop [?] to Robert Underwood Johnson 1893 May 3;

scopecontent.p: Re an article that Lathrop [?] may write about oriental art, mentions Dr. W. S. Bigelow, Ernest Francisco Fenollosa, and Boston Museum of Fine Art.

did.unittitle: Kate Douglass Wiggin to Robert Underwood Johnson 1904 March 26;

scopecontent.p: Despite ill health, wants to be in "Fiction Number" and maintain Robert Underwood Johnson's audience.

did.unittitle: Ethel Brilliana Tweedie to Robert Underwood Johnson 1905 June 20;

scopecontent.p: Is sending first four chapters of book on Porfirio Diaz, wants it published in an American magazine, describes remainder of book, mentions price.

did.unittitle: William Merritt Chase to Robert Underwood Johnson 1908 May 11;

scopecontent.p: Is pleased to hear that Robert Underwood Johnson has accepted his Whistler article, mentions photographs of portraits of and by Whistler, mentions a Keats portrait.

did.unittitle: Edwin Howland Blackfield to Robert Underwood Johnson 1910 Apr 17;

scopecontent.p: Thanks for showing of his work in Century.
Wants to know what has become of a poetic contribution, "ZR and The Roma," which he sent to the Editor.

did.unittitle: Robert Underwood Johnson to William Orton Tewson 1925 Jan 12;

scopecontent.p: Thanks for return of poem on dirigibles, is not hostile toward Tewson's conduct of The Literary Review, but prefers traditional poetry rather than current tendencies.

did.unittitle: Gilbert Parker to Robert Underwood Johnson May 9;

scopecontent.p: Says that manuscript of a tale of the Straits Settlements, called "Cummer's Son," will be sent to Johnson, asks Johnson to cable if he wants it at $800, is going to Hungary.

did.unittitle: Jacob August Riis to Robert Underwood Johnson Thursday;

scopecontent.p: Sends proofs, is excited about illustrations for the article, has arrangd for tickets to be sent to Robert Underwood Johnson.
